intro: Schoenocaulon jaliscense, commonly known as the Jalisco stonecrop, is a succulent plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Crassulaceae family and is characterized by its thick, fleshy leaves that store water, allowing it to thrive in arid environments. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils, often in mountainous regions. Its small, star-shaped flowers are usually white or pale pink, blooming in early summer. Due to its unique appearance and adaptability, it is sometimes cultivated as an ornamental plant.
